intro: Ferulago sulcata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ferulago, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive, serrated edge. Ferulago sulcata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
